result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both Operating w/ PAC (3rd) and OWI (3rd). The defendant was found guilty of Operating w/ PAC (3rd) and the other charge, OWI (3rd) was dismissed by the court.

  • Mark A Gunderlach was found guilty of Operating w/ PAC (3rd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $200 represents DNA surcharge.  $35 represents Blood Draw Test fee.
With credit for any administrative suspension.

Ignition Interlock Device shall be installed prior to operating a motor vehicle.  The length of Ignition Interlock Device will begin when a valid driver's license or occupational license has been issued.  (Call Dept of Motor Vehicles with questions).
